New Records: David Fry doesn't repeat his home run heroics against Clay Holmes.
Jhonkensy Noel can't repeat his Game 3 home run.
Giancarlo Stanton gives the Yankees a 6-2 lead by crushing a fastball over the plate into the left-field seats.
Key Match Events: Alex Verdugo hit a weak grounder to shortstop that Cleveland Guardians shortstop Brayan Rocchio couldn’t field cleanly in the ninth inning and the New York Yankees won 8-6 in Game 4 of the American League Championship Series.
Jhonkensy Noel drew a one-out walk and Andres Gimenez singled, but Bo Naylor flied out to center field, and Rocchio grounded out to second to end the game.
Jose Ramirez and Josh Naylor make this a 6–5 game.
Clay Holmes wins rematch with David Fry.

David Fry hits a grounder toward first base, which is fielded by Mark Leiter Jr. But Leiter can't toss the ball cleanly to Anthony Rizzo, and it goes between his legs. That allows Bo Naylor to score the tying run.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Boone on moving Jazz Chisholm Jr. to cleanup.
Will Yankees use closer Luke Weaver tonight?
Yankees lineup, Game 4: Jazz Chisholm Jr. at cleanup, Luis Gil makes first postseason start
Post-Match Reflections: The game-winning run came to the plate for the Guardians after Jhonkensy Noel drew a one-out walk and Andres Gimenez singled. But Bo Naylor flew out to center field, and Brayan Rocchio grounded out to second base to end the game.
New York can clinch the AL pennant and a trip to the World Series on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tanner Bibee will start Game 5 with the Guardians' season at stake.
Carlos Rodon gets the starting nod for the Yankees on Saturday, with first pitch scheduled for 8:08 p.m. ET.
Others: Cade Smith was Cleveland’s fourth pitcher of the game and came into Friday’s matchup having allowed just one run in nine postseason innings. He had a disastrous result in Game 4.
The Yankees take a 3–1 series lead.
